content.text: This section establishes comprehensive policies and procedures for the protection of personal data, management of school records, and governance of information systems.

items: Protect privacy rights: Ensure that personal data of students, staff, parents, and other stakeholders is collected, processed, stored, and disposed of in accordance with legal requirements and ethical standards.
Maintain record integrity: Establish systematic record-keeping practices that support educational excellence, regulatory compliance, and organizational accountability.
Ensure system security: Implement technical and organizational measures to safeguard information systems against unauthorized access, data breaches, and operational disruptions.

content.text: The school adheres to internationally recognized data protection principles aligned with UU No. 27/2022 (Indonesian Personal Data Protection Law) and GDPR best practices.

items: Lawfulness, Fairness, and Transparency: All data processing has a valid legal basis.
Purpose Limitation: Data is collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes.
Data Minimization: Only data that is adequate, relevant, and necessary for the purpose is collected.
Accuracy: Reasonable steps are taken to ensure data is accurate and kept up to date.
Storage Limitation: Data is retained only for as long as necessary for the purpose or as required by law.
Integrity and Confidentiality: Appropriate measures protect data against unauthorized access, loss, or destruction.
Accountability: The school is responsible for demonstrating compliance with all principles.

content.text: Comprehensive technical safeguards protect electronic data across all school systems.

items: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): Access to data is restricted based on user roles.
Authentication and Password Security: Strong password policies and multi-factor authentication are enforced.
Session Management: Automatic logout after periods of inactivity.
Data Encryption: All data transmitted and stored is encrypted.
Audit Logging: All user actions are logged for accountability.

content.text: A DPIA is a systematic process to identify and minimize data protection risks arising from new or changed data processing activities.

items: Mandatory DPIAs for high-risk processing activities.
Structured seven-step DPIA process including description, necessity assessment, risk identification, mitigation measures, and approval.

content.text: Systematic records management ensures the school retains documents for as long as necessary while securely disposing of them when no longer needed.

content.title: Retention Periods
rows: Until student turns 21 or 5 years after leaving

content.text: A data breach is a security incident that leads to unauthorized or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, disclosure of, or access to personal data.

items: Immediate response procedures to be followed within 24 hours of detection.
Risk assessment and classification within 72 hours.
Notification procedures to affected individuals and regulatory authorities.
